meanings.definition: To reduce the size or scale of a photograph.
meanings.sent1: I will photoreduce this picture to fit it in the frame.
meanings.sent2: She decided to photoreduce the image to make it smaller.
meanings.sent3: Trying to photoreduce a group photo may result in tiny faces!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to photoreduce the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The magician's wand could photoreduce objects in an instant.

meanings.definition: To decrease the intensity or brightness of a photograph.
meanings.sent1: The photographer needed to photoreduce the exposure for a better shot.
meanings.sent2: He used software to photoreduce the brightness of the picture.
meanings.sent3: Don't photoreduce the brightness too much, or the image will look dull.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds seemed to photoreduce the sunlight in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The dimmer switch can photoreduce the harshness of the light.

meanings.definition: The act of reducing the size or scale of a photograph.
meanings.sent1: The photoreduce of the landscape made it more suitable for the brochure.
meanings.sent2: Her job involved the photoreduce of images for the website.
meanings.sent3: The photoreduce of the family portrait made everyone look like tiny figurines.
meanings.sent4: The photoreduce of the cityscape captured only the essence of the skyline.
meanings.sent5: The photoreduce of the painting highlighted the intricate details.
